statuses.label: Backlog
statuses.description: Game stories identified but not yet refined. Requirements may be incomplete or need design work.

statuses.label: Ready for Dev
statuses.description: Game stories with complete design specs, ready for implementation. All mechanics are defined.

statuses.label: In Progress
statuses.description: Currently being implemented. Developer is actively working on the game feature.

statuses.label: Review
statuses.description: Implementation complete, awaiting playtest and code review before merging.

statuses.label: Human Review
statuses.description: Awaiting human review and approval. Complete all checklist items before moving to Done.

statuses.label: Done
statuses.description: Implemented, tested, and verified. The game feature is complete.

statuses.label: Optional
statuses.description: Nice-to-have game features that are not required for the current milestone.

agents.name: Samus Shepard
agents.description: Lead Game Designer and Creative Vision Architect. Creates Game Design Documents, defines mechanics, systems, and game-type-specific features.
agents.whenToUse: At the start of a game project to define mechanics, create GDDs, and design game systems.
examplePrompts: Create a GDD for a 2D platformer
Design the combat mechanics for the RPG
Define the progression system for the puzzle game

agents.name: Cloud Dragonborn
agents.description: Principal Game Systems Architect and Technical Director. Handles engine selection, system architecture, and technical specifications.
agents.whenToUse: After game design to select engine (Unity, Unreal, Godot), design architecture, and create technical specs.
examplePrompts: Design the entity component system architecture
Select the best engine for our puzzle game
Create the networking architecture for multiplayer

agents.name: Max
agents.description: Game Development Scrum Master and Sprint Orchestrator. Tracks milestones, manages sprints, and facilitates retrospectives.
agents.whenToUse: During production to plan sprints, track progress, prepare stories, and run retrospectives.

agents.name: Link Freeman
agents.description: Senior Game Developer and Technical Implementation Specialist. Implements game features, systems, and mechanics following the GDD and architecture.
agents.whenToUse: When game stories are ready for development, or when code needs review.
examplePrompts: Review the code changes for the inventory feature
Add unit tests for the combat module

agents.name: Indie
agents.description: Elite Indie Game Developer and Quick Flow Specialist. Combines rapid prototyping with flexible development for solo developers and small teams.
agents.whenToUse: For quick prototypes, rapid iteration, or when working solo without full planning overhead.
examplePrompts: Quick prototype the core gameplay loop
Create a playtest plan for the demo

agents.name: GLaDOS
agents.description: Game QA Architect and Test Automation Specialist. Creates test frameworks, playtest plans, and validates performance requirements.
agents.whenToUse: When setting up testing infrastructure, creating playtest plans, or validating game performance.
examplePrompts: Set up the game testing framework
Create a playtest plan for the demo level
Validate the performance on target hardware
